item.description:
Let's explore Ravenswood Park and take advantage of great Spring weather and longer days!  I've been here a couple times, but this will be a bit of "winging it"...so I'll bring a map and we can decide what trails we want to take.  It's a beautiful park, with a mix of packed gravel roads and wooded trails.  I would say this is a relatively easy walk, but many trails do have some inclines or hills to climb, and some rocks/roots to step over or around.  We'll walk at a pace of about 3 miles an hour. Ravenswood is dog friendly, so I'll be bringing Paycee (my dog)...feel free to bring your own canine- and people-friendly pooch, as well as bug spray and water. 

We'll walk for about 1-1/2 hrs, then those who would like to can join me at Stage Fort Park (2 miles away) where you can order dinner from The Cupboard (burgers, sandwiches, seafood) or grab an ice cream cone.  Or bring your own picnic dinner.  We can eat at one of the park's picnic tables overlooking the harbour, and after take the short, scenic stroll through the park if we'd like, to finish up the evening. 

This event will be cancelled due to inclement weather or lack of interest.  It is posted with the North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers and Social Fun.
item.why: We have plenty of daylight to take advantage of a long walk after work, and both parks are beautiful!

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: Walk at Ravenswood (Gloucester)- followed by dinner at Stage Fort Park
